title: Ticket #3474: DAGMan jobs and Condor-C
description:
Igor reports that when using multiple logs with DAGMan and submitting to grid universe Condor, one gets: 
012 (4326.000.000) 01/30 16:25:52 Job was held.
       Failed to initialize user log to /dev/null or <path to DAGManNodesLog>
       Code 22 Subcode 0

Igor also reports this reproduces 100% of the time.

It appears that the code for multiple logs was added by nwp on commit 2834e640. See also htcondor-support #8256.
remarks:
2013-Feb-01 14:53:25 by sfiligoi:
Just to be clear: The path of the dagmanlog is valid (and is not /dev/null).

The message is just misleading.

2013-Feb-01 15:03:48 by nwp:
Can you provide a JobAd where this is happening? It will help in debugging.

2013-Feb-01 15:19:50 by sfiligoi:
Submit file with problems: 
universe = grid
grid_resource = condor red.unl.edu red.unl.edu:9619

executable = a.sh
output = a.out.$(Cluster).$(Process)
error = a.err.$(Cluster).$(Process)
log = a.log
DAGManNodesLog=b.log

ShouldTransferFiles = YES
WhenToTransferOutput = ON_EXIT

x509userproxy = /home/sfiligoi/.globus/x509_igor_cms

queue 1

Submit file without problems: 

universe = grid
grid_resource = condor red.unl.edu red.unl.edu:9619

executable = a.sh
output = a.out.$(Cluster).$(Process)
error = a.err.$(Cluster).$(Process)
log = a.log

ShouldTransferFiles = YES
WhenToTransferOutput = ON_EXIT

x509userproxy = /home/sfiligoi/.globus/x509_igor_cms

queue 1

2013-Feb-01 15:46:03 by nwp:
Question ought to be "What is Condor-C doing that it gives a hoot about DAGManNodesLog?"

2013-Feb-01 16:36:17 by wenger:
Yeah, that's was I was wondering. I don't know why Condor-C should care about this... (I initially thought that an invalid path was goofing things up, but Igor says any path, even valid, for DAGManNodesLog causes problems.)

2013-Feb-01 17:20:23 by bbockelm:
Isn't it as simple as just removing this attribute from the job by default when Condor-C is used?

Igor, what happens if you add the following to the submit file:

+remote_ DAGManNodesLog = /dev/null

?

2013-Feb-01 17:47:29 by bbockelm:
Igor asked me to explain more thoroughly -

Condor-C will copy all the attributes from the submit schedd to the remote schedd by default. In particular, DAGManNodesLog is copied to the remote side. In particular, if you have the htcondor-ce-client installed, you can do this: 

_condor_SUBMIT_EXPRS=DAGManNodesLog _condor_DAGManNodesLog="/tmp/baz/boo" condor_ce_run red.unl.edu:9619 echo "hello world"

On the remote side: 

[root@red ~]# condor_ce_q uscmsPool018 -held


-- Submitter: red.unl.edu : <129.93.239.129:9620?sock=8556_0571_4> : red.unl.edu
 ID       OWNER          HELD_SINCE  HOLD_REASON
43851.0   uscmsPool018    2/1  17:40 Failed to initialize user log to /dev/null or /tmp/baz/boo

1 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 0 idle, 0 running, 1 held, 0 suspended

(I made it so the /tmp/baz/ directory was root-owned on the CE but the user could write into it on the submit node). Then, on the submit side: 

[bbockelm@hcc-briantest rpmbuild]$ condor_q -held


-- Submitter: hcc-briantest.unl.edu : <129.93.244.208:33351> : hcc-briantest.unl.edu
 ID      OWNER          HELD_SINCE  HOLD_REASON
 132.0   bbockelm        2/1  17:41 Failed to initialize user log to /dev/null or /tmp/baz/boo

1 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 0 idle, 0 running, 1 held, 0 suspended

While we're at it, can we change the hold reason on the submit side to reflect where the hold is coming from?

2013-Feb-01 19:03:25 by nwp:
If both the userlog and the DAGManNodesLog are /dev/null, DAGMan will not get the events that track the job's progress. DAGMan will never see a job be submitted, execute, and terminate.

2013-Feb-04 12:16:41 by nwp:
From a discussion on #discomp: the plan should be to have Condor-C suppress the DAGManNodesLog attribute, verify that that works correctly, and write a job_dagman_condorc regression test to make sure it continues to work correctly.

2013-Feb-19 15:42:54 by wenger:
I think the initial description is a bit unclear/incorrect -- if I remember correctly, the problem happens when DAGMan uses the single default log file for all of the node jobs; if you just have DAGMan use the log files specified in the submit files, things work okay. So it fails with the default log file, but works if you have multiple log files (it should also work if you specify the same log file in each submit file -- it's the "default log" specification that goofs things up.

2013-Feb-25 15:49:00 by nwp:
Can Igor or Brian try condor-c with the attached patch?

2013-Mar-29 11:08:44 by jfrey:
This problem was triggered by #2807 with the addition of the DAGManNodesLog job attribute. We need to strip this attribute when submitting a Condor-C job to a remote schedd.

2013-Mar-29 11:49:00 by nwp:
This shows we need a DAGMAN/CondorC regression test.

2013-Mar-29 11:56:04 by wenger:
Just a reminder, stripping off the attribute at the Condor-C level will goof up DAGMan, because it will still expect events to be written to the "workflow log".

If DAGMan can correctly recognize a job as Condor-C, it can just turn off the "workflow log" option at the job level in the DAG, and that would solve the problem. My brain is still pretty spacey today -- can we do this just by looking for "universe = grid" in the submit file? If so, it's a pretty easy fix just in DAGMan...

2013-Mar-29 13:50:50 by jfrey:
The job submitted by DAGMan would still have the DAGManNodesLog attribute and events for the job would still be written. It's only in the new job submitted by the gridmanager where DAGManNodesLog is omitted. The new job isn't being monitored by DAGMan.

2013-Mar-29 14:23:25 by wenger:
Okay, that seems fine, then -- I thought the stripping off of the attribute would prevent DAGMan from seeing the events in the "workflow log".

2013-Apr-02 16:03:02 by jfrey:
I verified that when a HTCondor-C job has dagman_log set, the DAGMan log contains entries only for the HTCondor-C job, and not the new job submitted by the c-gahp.
attachments:
• condorc-daglog.patch 580 bytes added by jfrey on 2013-Feb-19 21:03:53 UTC.
    Fix Condor-C jobs that have DAGManNodesLog set.
check_ins:
2013-Apr-11 13:01   Check-in [35378]: better formatting of 7.9.6 version history item ===GT=== #3474 (By Karen Miller )
2013-Apr-02 16:00   Check-in [35312]: Version history for Condor-C DAGMan log bug. #3474 (By Jaime Frey )
2013-Mar-29 11:02   Check-in [35290]: Remove DAGManNodesLog attribute from Condor-C jobs. #3474 This attribute specifies a log that job events should be written to. For Condor-C, it doesn't make sense to propogate this to the remote job ad. In fact, it will cause problems. (By Jaime Frey )
creator: bbockelm
